text: The Daren Sammy Cricket Ground, previously the Beausejour Cricket Ground, is a cricket ground located near Gros Islet, Saint Lucia standard seating capacity of 15,000. It was completed in 2002 and currently accommodates 13,000 spectators. Marvan Atapattu of Sri Lanka scored the first century while Brian Lara scored the first double-century on this ground in its inaugural Test match. Lara's innings of 209 is the highest score on the ground and the only double-century scored on the ground. India's Virender Sehwag has the highest score for a non-West Indies batsmen at the ground. A total of 17 centuries have been scored so far at the venue. Shivnarine Chanderpaul scored the first ODI century on the ground in 2002. England's Marcus Trescothick scored the first century by non-West Indies batsmen which is also the highest score on the ground. A total of seven ODI centuries have been scored on the ground. As of 8 September 2019, only one T20I century has been scored at the Daren Sammy Cricket Ground when Suresh Raina of India scored his only T20I century during the 2010 ICC World Twenty20. == Key == * * denotes that the batsman was not out. * Inns. denotes the number of the innings in the match. * Balls denotes the number of balls faced in an innings. * NR denotes that the number of balls was not recorded. * Parentheses next to the player's score denotes his century number at Edgbaston. * The column title Date refers to the date the match started. * The column title Result refers to the player's team result == Test Centuries == The following table summarizes the Test centuries scored at Daren Sammy Cricket Ground. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:95%" !
